This doesn't fix the problem completely as according to [RFC 3986][1] sub-delims are allow unescaped within a path segment:

    # from page 12
    sub-delims  = "!" / "$" / "&" / "'" / "(" / ")"
                  / "*" / "+" / "," / ";" / "="

    # from page 22
    pchar         = unreserved / pct-encoded / sub-delims / ":" / "@"

The real problem is [here][2] and [here][3] – `Rack::Utils.unescape` is treating it like form data. What we should use is `URI::Parser.unescape` with a regexp for the appropriate characters. It needs to be fixed both here and in `Rack::File` as that performs a `File.file?` check as well. Do you want me to create a pull request for Rack? Also should it be backported previous versions of Rails and Rack?

[1]: http://www.ietf.org/rfc/rfc3986.txt
[2]: https://github.com/rails/rails/blob/master/actionpack/lib/action_dispatch/middleware/static.rb#L14
[3]: https://github.com/rack/rack/blob/master/lib/rack/file.rb#L40
